title: What should I bring to a KPOP Concert? - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t really need to bring much, just yourself! There are a few things though that I would suggest. Now I’ve actually only been to one concert, and it wasn’t your average K-pop concert, so I don’t know a whole lot, but I am going to a Monsta X concert soon. The concert I went to was Day6, so they didn’t dance around or anything but I’m pretty sure what I brought you can bring to any concert. Since it was my first concert I didn’t really know what to bring, but I’m glad I brought what I did. So I actually made my own sign (I don’t know why I did I was in the very back of the venue but whatever), and I didn’t use it because I was in the back of the venue and I didn’t want to block people’s view. The sign actually ended up falling out of my purse so yes I was kind of sad about that but there is nothing I can do about that now. Another really good one I should have put first is merch. Now I went full out here. I made my own Day6 headband out of felt and glitter and it looked amazing but I ended up not wearing it because it was annoying and again blocked peoples view. I also made my own stickers and I decorated my purse with them (I almost lost these stickers too but I still have them so its all good). I made a locket necklace containing one of the members as well and wore that all night (I got a compliment on that one, it was a really cool necklace). Last but not least I wore my (awesome) Day6 tshirt and then bought a hoodie at the venue that I wore as well. So yeah, you could say I was a bit excited about my first K-pop concert. Just wait until you hear the rest. Binoculars. Yes, I brought binoculars. I mean, I was in the back of the venue, and I’m that person who loves to see her idols up close with my own two eyes, so yeah. I think that was seriously the best choice I have ever made. Sitting in the back I could see their faces, but not much. I was satisfied with that, but the binoculars just made it even more amazing. You see your idols up close and seriously it seemed like I could reach out and touch them. Just watching them perform like that was amazing, and it really was surreal. OH and I also got some amazing photos with them. Being the super smart person I am (haha no) I put my phone up to the lens and so it zoomed in my camera, and I got perfectly clear close up shots of them. It was seriously amazing. But you don’t have to bring these, especially if you are in the front row/pit or you just don’t feel like bringing them. (you could bring a small pair, mine were very large so it was easier to see them but you do you). And that brings me to my next thing to bring, a phone. The venues wont usually let you bring big cameras (mine didn’t) so I brought my phone instead. I just used mine for photos and videos (A lot of them, I always want to remember as best I can). Make sure to have storage on your phone. I ran out 3/4 of the way in and had to use my moms phone for the rest. Now take advice from me and don’t spend the whole concert just trying to get the best shots or videos, I kind of did that and I regret it but I enjoyed the concert so much anyways. Just don’t focus on that and enjoy yourself and the music. And if you are bringing a phone, bring a portable phone charger. You don’t realize how fast those things die until you are halfway through your favorite song and your phone decides to go wack on you. Now this is optional, but a lightstick. I actually didn’t buy the Day6 lightband, I didn’t have the money and you don’t really need a lightstick. Yes they are fun, but they are also expensive so if you don’t have one it’s not like you’re a terrible fan. I really wanted the lightband, yes, but it turned out not many people brought one and so they really aren’t a must have. But I will say that if you do have the money and you want it, go right ahead. I actually bought the Monsta X lightstick not too long ago because I am going to their concert and I didn’t have a lightstick for the first one so I thought it would be fun. So it’s not like they are bad, they are really fun and a great way to show off your support I’m just saying if you don’t have one its not the end of the world (but yes they are really cool and I honestly wanted an excuse to buy the Monsta X one because it’s my favorite lightstick besides the Carat Bong) Last but not least, water and food. Now usually you can’t actually bring these, but you just want to make sure you are hydrated and fed well before you go and jump around at a concert. If there is water at the venue though, buy it. You will need it. Trust me. I hope this helped, it’s all I can think of but I hope it helps you out! None of these you have to bring, it’s just what I brought but you do you. If you are going to a concert, have fun!!! It’s really such an amazing experience. :)

wear merch: a hoodie, snapback, shirt etc. Wear something that makes you feel good about yourself. Nobody wants to feel self conscious about their body while jamming out at a concert! Wear something comfortable. No right pants that you can't move in and no right shirts that cut off your breath! Wear runners. No heels! As pretty as they are, they will kill your feet and destroy your dancing! No sandals either! Once again, broken toes will destroy your dancing vibe. Almost everyone will be wearing converse Things to bring: Essentials: Tickets (obviously) Wallet ID Phone Support:Lightstick Banner/ poster (optional) Entertainment: Ipod/mp3 player Earphones/ headphones Powerbank Headache medicine/anything else you think you might need Hygiene: Makeup (if you wear it, for a touch up) Breath mints Lip balm Gum Water Compact hairbrush Hairties Tissues Deodorant Pads/tampons Optional: Snacks/energy bars (optional/hide them) Selfie stick (to make fan cams) Have fun!!

YES I can SO answer this as I have been to nu'est, big bang, vixx, Eric Nam, and got7, kard, Bap and bts :) u should bring either the groups official lightstick or those basic glows ticks from dollarstore if u don't have their official ones. I brought the dollar store ones with me to Bap concert and gave the extra ones to new friends I met that day and one of the girls gave him Chan one of them to hold during the concert :) u can come with a kpop banner showing love and support for the group and or bias. also u can dress urself off with kpop clothing :3 I also bring my photo cards to the concert so I can fangirl with other fans and maybe trade photo cards. also pack a comfortable bag and shoes with u and have a cell charger with u. although u can't take videos or photos at these concerts.. some groups were totally chill about being filmed (like bap gladly welcomed it although we were told it wasn't allowed)

Water bottle — to drink, not to be thrown on stage. It hurts your idol.Slogan/cheering kit — to show your idol some support. If you don’t have any, there are usually people giving out hand banner for free!Lightstick — if your idol has one. If not, you can just use pen light stick that promoter usually provided.Fan — portable electric fan or just hand fan in general. Depends on the venue, though. It could be hot if you’re waiting outdoor. Umbrella helps too.Doll — there are always pretty, small doll that represents your idol. Bring it as a form of support.Powerbank — your phone battery could die and there are no place to recharge, so always bring a portable charger! You don’t want to miss recording your idol performance on stage, right?That’s what I could think of now. If you’re going to one, have fun!

I’m gonna make this practical and short so it can be easy and useful! Wear merch!! You wanna show your love for this band/artist, don’t you?Bring their official lightstick if they have one and/or if you can afford one. It isn’t necessary if you can’t afford one, but if you do have one or can afford one, go right ahead!This one is from personal experience. Don’t bring food items or a water bottle. If you wanna bring something, bring it in a small purse, not a carry bag. I bought with me a carry bag with water and food, but they didn’t let me through with them. It might not be the same for all concerts, but just keep that in mind.Depending on the weather, dress accordingly! Don’t go in wearing a crop top and shorts if it’s cold! Don’t go in like an Eskimo if it’s warm! Dress accordingly!!Also, my phone battery died even though I charged it fully. So, bring a portable charger.That’s all I could recommend :) Have fun at your concert!!

There are quite a few things so forgive me if I miss anything. Lightstick / fanlight. You definitely want to bring one of these! It’s not technically a requirement, but it’ll really boost the experience by being part of those cool waves and etc!Bottled water.Extra money. You might want to buy some nice things you see in the merch shops and stuff, but also you will need it to buy food probably since they may ask you to get rid of the food you already have. Plus money is always handy to have.Toiletries. You gotta stay clean and you don’t wanna feel all icky!Camera / Phone. You may want to film some of it! Remember not to watch the whole concert through your camera though but you may want to film a bit but if you want to film a lot you may want to bring two things for recording with.Portable Charger. Your phone battery could die and that would NOT be good!

Well make sure to read the rules and guidelines for the venue that is holding the concert. Here's some personal tips. Stay hydrated. A tiny water bottle would work.Bring a portable charger. (My phone died half way through the concert.)Don't bring a big bag.Plan out your way getting there and getting back if you're taking public transportation. (I went to the Citi Gield Concert for BTS and left immediately after the concert ended.)Have a great time. Don't record too much. Take it as much as you can with your eyes.Wear what you think would be comfortable whether it's sneakers or heels (I wouldn't wear heels in GA though, haha.)Make sure to find out if you can just scan your tickets on your phone or if you have to print them out.I would eat before the concert but something light. (Half a sandwich, a small salad, etc.)

Battery Pack/Charger - my phone died at the beginning of the concert so… Clear Bag - my sister had to throw away her bad since we didn't have time to go put it in a locker and it wasn't clear. This may depend on the group. Lightstick and other group merch if you have it - just incase traffic was bad and you are running late and won't make it to the mercy stands Cash - always have extra cash with you… Coat if it is cold - you do not want to be standing outside for over 3 hours in a tee shirt if it is below 40 degrees outside, i would know. ~ That is all i can think of that you FOR SURELY need for a kpop concert. Thanks for the request ^.^ ×××사랑해×××

Read the rules of the venue before going to the concert. Do not bring a camera because there could be a ban on cameras. Cell phones are allowed. Bring money and a credit card for emergencies or to buy merch. Bring a sweatshirt or light jacket because it will get cooler later on. Wear comfortable shoes since you'll be dancing and standing up. Dont wear a dress, skirt or short shorts. There is a lot of contact with strangers. Skin to skin contact isn't good. T shirt, jeans and sneakers is the perfect outfit. Most important have lots of fun!

I am an indonesian and I’ve only been to BP concert, so this is my answer: Powerbank, you will film a lot so expect some powerbanks. Unless you’re just there to enjoy i guess you don’t need oneMoney. Don’t bring food, bring money. They usually take all snacks and water in the security check . But inside there are booth who sells food to eat. They are pricy so bring a bunch of moneyBring food if you guys have to wait outside. Obviously waiting is hours so u don’t wanna starve yourselfJackets, sometimes the AC could get really cold during waittimeIf you want to get your bias attention, make some stupid hilarious banners, and raise them when they get to your side. One of the fans from my concert brought a doll, with their childhood faces on it

I would definitely wear outfits that support whatever kpop band you are going to, deck out in their outfits! Bring any light to wave around while they sing, bring a poster maybe and if you are close to the stage they may notice you and give you a high five or something, If you are meeting them I would bring something they can autograph like an albumn of theirs or a poster. I would defiantly bring a camera to take some sweet pictures

Make sure you stay hydrated, but food and water aren’t allowed normally in these kinds of venues so make sure you bring cash. If you have a lightstick for the group, bring it ! Bring a portable charger of some sort. Don’t wear too much makeup - it will all be melted off by the end of it. Bring something to help you cool down. Don’t bring a camera, they are not allowed. Have fun at your concert!

You should bring.Merch, like BTS hoodies and Lightsticks (show your support!)Even bring a phone to post on your instagram that you were at the concert. Keep a couple of pictures so you can remember this moment. You can also bring a poster or a banner with “BTS” or “I LOVE BTS/ (insert-bias)” if you want. It will be an amazing and fun time! I promise you.
You should bring a small amount of cash or one credit card, your ID (if you’re drinking), your phone, and your car key. Don’t bring anything you wouldn’t want to loose. Concerts are dark and crowded.

Depending on the group you’re seeing, bring their signature army bomb, but it doesn’t really matter. The fact that you went at all makes them happy. (Though, is im being honest, you might feel a bit left out when the idol group tells everyone to take out Their bombs and do something specific.)

a light stick or a flashlight if you don’t have a light stickFood/drink (not sure if they allow food but if they do bring some)Comfy shoes cause concerts can be longMoney for the store where they sell lots kpop perchThat’s really it. Not much but

Your phone and cash. Do not wear a sweater or bring a jacket if you’re in the pit, it will get so hot! Chances of you being able to use your phone are low, but you never know, bring it anyway. And if you want to “represent” (insert chest-bump here) buy a BTS light stick. Hope this helped.

Everyone already covered most everything, but most concerts/stadiums state you need a clear bag, so I highly recommend buying one on amazon! Also portable charger, your phone will die with the amount of videos/photos you take!
Some things you should bring to a kpop concert is. Clear bag: to carry your thingsWater:to hydrate and buying water is expensiveLightstick (if you have one)A positive attitude

Based on my experience to the BTS Love Yourself tour I went to, I would bring a water or whatever drink you’d prefer, a tote bag or small string bag, your light stick (if owned), food/snacks, & a friend if you want. ~Hope this helps!
MerchA light/glow stickPhonePortable ChargerWear comfortable clothesHope this answer helps!
Lots of love and hugs for the BTS members! Just joking
